title: Bind Lottie Image Source

comments.author: pvoelker
comments.body: OK, I figured out the problem.  I was trying to bind against a 'string'.   I need to bind against SKLottieImageSource.  Which required the use of SKLottieImageSourceConverter.ConvertFromString

comments.author: Strypper
comments.body:
> OK, I figured out the problem. I was trying to bind against a 'string'. I need to bind against SKLottieImageSource. Which required the use of SKLottieImageSourceConverter.ConvertFromString

I try the converter but nothing appears

comments.author: pvoelker
comments.body:
Maybe this will help.  Here is the code I have...

_XAML Snippet_
`<skia:SKLottieView IsVisible="{Binding Path=LottieImage, Converter={StaticResource ObjectNotNullToBool}}" Source="{Binding Path=LottieImage}" RepeatCount="1" HorizontalOptions="Fill" VerticalOptions="Fill" IsComplete="{Binding Path=IsAnimationComplete}"> </skia:SKLottieView>`

_View-Model Snippets_
`private SKLottieImageSourceConverter _lottieConverter = new SKLottieImageSourceConverter();`

`private SKLottieImageSource _lottieImage = null;`
`public SKLottieImageSource LottieImage`
`{`
`    get => _lottieImage;`
`    set => SetProperty(ref _lottieImage, value);`
`}`

`LottieImage = (SKLottieImageSource)_lottieConverter.ConvertFromString(_name-of-raw-resource_);`

comments.author: Strypper
comments.body:
```
Source="{x:Binding ComponentData.LottieUrl,
                               Source={x:Reference root},
                               Mode=OneWay,
                               Converter={x:StaticResource SKLottieImageSourceConverter}}"
```
Here is my version The `ComponentData.LottieUrl` is `string` type and actual value is `dotnetbot.json` 
I used the converter but still nothing appear, when I hard code set the value on XAML it show up just fine
